17.description: Source Description / Text / Defines the data source which provided details of this unit

18.description: Source Version Details / Text / Defines the version of the data source which provided details of this unit

19.description: Source Unit Code / Variant / Defines the unit code used by the data source which provided details of this unit. This item is written in the units used to define unit codes by the data source

7.description: Field Name / Text / Can be Field, Lead or Prospect name Use “Unknown Field” if unknown

9.description: Country Name / Text / E.g., “Brazil” Use “Unknown country” if information not available

9.description: Structure Reference Point Number/ SRP defined in H7,4,0,0 Coordinates in the referenced O7 record

10.description: Structure Reference Point Description/ Structure horizontal reference point,  e.g., “Platform centre”

13.description: Structure Vertical Coordinate Description/ See Table 11 For Land use “Ground Level” or “Top Cellar”, as appropriate For Marine use “Sea Floor” Blank if not applicable

14.description: Structure North Reference Direction Type / 1=True North2=Grid North (must be of projected CRSREF 2)EPSG code=if different from 2 3=Unknown. Blank if not applicable

15.description: Structure North Heading / Clockwise angle in degrees from the reference direction to the local structure north direction. Blank if not applicable

9.description: Well Reference Point Reference Number / eg. 1/WRP defined in H7,4,0,0 Coordinates in the referenced O7 record

10.description: Primary UWI / Given by regulator or other entity

11.description: Primary Well Name / As designated by primary authority

12.description: Primary Authority Name / Regulator (e.g., “ANP”), Operator (e.g., “Shell”), or 3rd party (e.g., “IHS”)

14.description: Alternate Well Name(s) / Ordered as above UWIs Blank if none

15.description: Alternate Authority Name(s) / Ordered as above names Blank if none

8.description: Slot Diameter / eg. 13.1875 / Inches or millimetres expected (expressed as decimal number) Leave blank if not applicable

9.description: Slot Diameter Unit / eg. 10 / Leave blank if not applicable

10.description: Structure north coordinate (WRP offset from SRP) / eg. 36.0 / Structure north direction defined in Structure Definition record (H7,1,1,0) / Unit per projected CRS / Blank if not applicable / float / comment: Offsets (relative to the SRP), or “structure coordinates”, are optional and given with the intention to enable QC of the well location coordinates. Firstly, slots are often arranged in a regular pattern with consistent distances from the SRP, such that the magnitudes of the offsets enable QC. Secondly, the slot WRP projected coordinates (and other fixed objects) are required to be explicitly provided and used by software (using O7 records). These coordinates can redundantly be computed from the local offsets defined in this record relative to the SRP using a similarity transformation and compared for QC.

11.description: Structure east coordinate (WRP offset from SRP) / eg. 8.0 / Structure east direction defined in Structure Definition record (H7,1,1,0) / Unit per projected CRS / Blank if not applicable

7.description: Parent Well Reference Number / eg. 1 / ref: well_definition.6

8.description: Primary UWBI / eg. "1234567890" / Given by regulator or other entity

9.description: Primary Wellbore Name / eg. "207/29-2Z" / As designated by primary authority

10.description: Primary Authority Name / Regulator (e.g., “ANP”), Operator (e.g., “Shell”), or 3rd party (e.g., “IHS”)

12.description: Alternate Wellbore Name(s) / Ordered as above UWIs Blank if none

13.description: Alternate Authority Name(s) / Ordered as above names Blank if none

14.description: Proposed or Actual Wellbore / Use “Proposed” or “Actual”

15.method: For United States OCS blocks: The lease number assigned to the lease that contains the bottomhole location of a borehole. More information and specific details on Well Naming and Numbering Standards can be found in NTL 2000-N07 (e.g., G09999, Y09999, A09999, or P09999).
15.description: Bottom Hole Lease Number / eg. "207/29" / At surface location

16.method: For United States OCS blocks: The Well Name Suffix is an extension to the wellbore name which identifies each wellbore and indicates the number of times a well has been sidetracked or bypassed. An 8- character suffix to the well number identifies a sidetrack (ST) or bypass (BP) and the sidetrack and bypass number (e.g., STNNBPNN). An original hole will have a suffix of STOOBPOO, the first sidetrack off the original borehole will have a suffix of ST01BPOO, the first bypass off the original borehole will have a suffix of STOOBP01. If the first sidetrack is bypassed, the suffix will be ST01BP01. More information and specific details on Well Naming and Numbering Standards can be found in NTL 2000-NO7. (This practice is suggested to be followed in the P7/17 for other jurisdictions in absence of other guidance, as appropriate.)
16.description: Wellbore Name Suffix / eg. "ST00BP00" / Leave blank if not applicable

17.method: Kick-off depth and tie-in point coordinates are defined via the Survey Definition record. Repeat record for each wellbore in the file.
17.description: Kick-off Date / eg. 2020:02:21 / YYYY:MM:DD Use planned date if wellbore is not drilled yet Use Spud date for primary wellbore leave blank if unknown

7.description: Rig/Workover Name / Use “Unknown Rig” if Rig/Workover name is unavailable

11.description: ZDP Type / “Derrick Floor”, “Kelly Bushing”, etc., see Table 11

12.description: Rig Type / 0: unknown 1: Land rig 2: Slant rig 3: Barge 4: Submersible 5: Platform 6: Jackup 7: Floater 8: Semi-submersible 9: Drill ship

6.description: Survey Reference Number / Integer / SURVEYREF / Defines a new Survey

7.description: Wellbore Reference Number / Integer / WELLBOREREF / Enables one to obtain the WRP and SRP used

8.description: Rig/Workover ZDP Reference Number / Integer / RIGREF / Enables one to obtain the ZDP used / ref: Rig/Workover_ZDP_definition.6

9.description: Survey Name / Text / Free format, generally defined by Operator

10.description: Measurement Tool Type / Text List / “Magnetic”, “Gyro”, “Inertial”, “Inclination-only”, “Utility”, “Blind”, “Composite”, or “Unknown” Align with Table 13 if MTREF is given List order recommended from bit upwards / comment: field 10-11: If the BHA contains multiple tools (e.g., Magnetic and Gyro) then these fields allow the definition of a list. The recommended order is from the bit upwards. In many cases there will be a single tool and field 11 will be blank if the tool is not further defined (no H7,2,0,0 record). “Blind” is added to the list in Table 13 to enable exchange of a survey where no azimuth or inclination is available. “Composite” and “Unknown” are added to facilitate exchange of data that do not require tool details

11.description: Measurement Tool Reference / Integer / List MTREF / MTREF in H7,2,0,0: Measurement Tool Definition (mandatory if file contains raw data) Use same order as in field 10 Leave blank if MTREF is not defined. / ref: **********************************^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

14.description: Run Direction / Text / Use “In”, “Out”, or “Combined” Leave blank if unknown

19.description: Date Survey Ended / Date / End Date (YYYY:MM:DD) Leave blank if not available

Use the WOBJREF of the WRP if the survey is tied at the surface. Cannot be blank / ref: **********************************^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
